features: Cook up imaginative play with the interactive pretend toaster with loads of personality that teaches as you cook
Toddlers learn about numbers, counting and colors with three food buttons
Nine play pieces include two bread slices, a jelly jar, lid, an egg and bacon, served up on a plate with a fork and knife
Kids naturally experiment with cause and effect as they push the toast down and pop it up again; hear about opposites with the toast dial
Intended for ages 12+ months; Requires 2 AAA batteries; Batteries included for demo purposes only; New batteries recommended for regular use
body.description: Start the morning with a smile with the Yum-2-3 Toaster! Make friends with this sunny little toaster as you pretend to make breakfast. Put the bread in the toaster and learn about opposites as you choose your toast setting. Ready to count? Press the one, two, three food buttons to learn about numbers, colors, food names and recipes. Nine pretend play pieces include two slices of bread, a jelly jar and lid, a fried egg and bacon, all served up on a plate with a knife and fork. The delightful pop-up action of the toaster engages children with music and learning content. Serve up breakfast with a side of learning! Intended for ages 12+ months. Requires 2 AAA batteries. Batteries included for demo purposes only. New batteries recommended for regular use.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Teaches: Numbers & counting Pretend play Colors Opposites Toast up fun with the interactive Yum-2-3 Toaster! Press the number button, turn the dial and push the toaster handle to learn about numbers, food names, colors, and opposites through songs and pretend-play. Nine play pieces include everything needed to cook up a pretend breakfast. Put the bread in the toaster and watch the toaster’s mouth light up with a sunny smile as it talks and sings.

Features 1-2-3 Food Buttons Ready to count? Press the one, two, three food buttons to learn about numbers, colors, food names and recipes. Pop-Up Play Push the toast down, then press the handle to pop up the toast to hear songs and learn about counting. Dial Up Opposites Turn the toast dial to learn about opposites by choosing light or dark toast. Imaginative Play Serve up a pretend breakfast with two slices of bread, a jelly jar and lid, a fried egg and bacon, with a plate, fork and knife.

Hear from our Learning Expert “The Yum-2-3 Toaster has delightful pop-up action that engages young ones in developing early number sense and counting skills. The interactive food buttons and accessories develop imaginative thinking and support playful ways to learn colors and opposites.” Ben J. Miller, Ph.D., LeapFrog Learning Expert

Hear from our Learning Expert “The Yum-2-3 Toaster has delightful pop-up action that engages young ones in developing early number sense and counting skills. The interactive food buttons and accessories develop imaginative thinking and support playful ways to learn colors and opposites.” Ben J. Miller, Ph.D., LeapFrog Learning Expert

LeapFrog Yum-2-3 Toaster LeapFrog Musical Rainbow Tea Party LeapFrog Shapes and Sharing Picnic Basket LeapFrog Scrub 'n Play Smart Sink LeapFrog Smart Sizzlin' BBQ Grill Item Model Number 80-609800 80-603200 80-603600 80-608100 80-607900 Age Range 12-36 Months 1-3 Years 6-36 Months 1.5-5 Years 1.5-5 Years Product Description Cook up learning with the pretend toaster and nine breakfast accessories It’s tea time! Pretend to brew a fresh pot of tea and share a slice of cake with friends while exploring colors, numbers, shapes and fruit. Pack a picnic for two and pretend to snack on yummy treats while exploring food, shapes and colors. Then, put the pieces back in the basket for fun on the go! Soak up fun and learning with the Scrub 'n Play Smart Sink! Count along with the soap pump and hear about colors and size with the talking dish rack. Six accessories included. Little grill masters sizzle up eight play foods with a smart skewer that identifies food, numbers and colors to keep learning on the menu with the Smart Sizzlin' BBQ Grill.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for a friend’s two year old daughter as a birthday gift. Apparently this is a huge “hit” at playtime. Cute, colorful and learning friendly. Excellent quality for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's so cute!
reviews.reviewText: Baby and I are fans of this perfect addition to his play kitchen! It's adorable, the perfect size, with fun features. He loves the pop up feature and putting the toast back in.The little jar of jam/jelly even opens!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Infant vs toaster, a short short story
reviews.reviewText: Durable and colorful set meant for play and learning, but 9 month olds may have other plans. Currently, our infant has deemed the following:1. Toast is not to be in the toaster. Its proper place is on the floor or tossed at the cat tower.2. The fork is good for gumming on, along with the egg.3. The knife is a warning to all who attempt to pinch her cheeks over the holidays. At least that is how her waving it about like a feather duster has been interpreted.4. The jam jar spins about nicely and makes a lovely "clunking" noise when falling from the high chair.5. Lastly the plate. Which somehow can be turned into a Frisbee, spinner, and snack tray, manages to be a daily favorite. Perhaps due to its versatility.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is cute gift for a birthday party! My niece hasn't received it to open and play with it yet but I bet she will love it. She loves food so I love that it is good play as well as educational.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Child’s Play Toaster
reviews.reviewText: Well designed, pieces large enough for small hands to handle.. toaster is sturdy and very appealing to look at

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This toy is really cute and provides opportunity for pretend play. The pieces are all a good size, nothing too small

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This little toaster is cute. One year old and four year old both enjoy playing with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute little set, not thrilled with one feature though
reviews.reviewText: This set was cuter than I thought it would be, the lid actually comes off the jam jar which I didn't expect, the pieces themselves are pretty durable in my opinion so far, the bread pieces aren't cheap and don't feel like they'd crack If my kids accidentally stepped on them which I know they will. I like the 1,2,3 detail in the center of the plate as well as the other small pictures on it, the toaster itself talks about the items it comes with, I love the little breakfast talks it gives, asking to spread the jam on the toast, I think it even said something about making an egg sandwich. So it gives my kids cute food ideas which I like.As for it being age appropriate I believe it said 12 months and up, my youngest who I got it for is 18 months old and he doesn't quite seem to get the concept of how to use the toast. To be fair I didn't at first either. Every kid is different though so my kids experience is likely totally different from yours. Like most toasters and toy ones though I'm usually used the Lever pulling the toast down and popping up after a minute. I pulled the Lever down and it made the toast pop up. My partner had to tell me I'm supposed to manually push the toast down myself a-ha.. I can't say I'm too thrilled with that feature if I had to give this item a con. I don't want my son thinking that's how toasters work.
My daughter loves this toy.Easy to hold with their small hands, plays music and talks.
A mi hija le gustó mucho, canciones lindas, fácil de usar, me habría gustado que fuera en español pero es duradero ha aguantado el uso rudo.
This is the cutest little thing lol my grandson is going to love it
Of all the things my 2 year old got this toaster is her fav. She plays with it daily and loves that the jam container opens.
